description: Schwartz 5 Awareness Levels - Single Source of Truth for the Universal Brand System

core_principle.axiom: Strategy = Prospect's Reality. Headlines must enter the ongoing conversation in their mind.
core_principle.mechanism: Match message directness to awareness level. Wrong match = message rejected.

levels.name: Most Aware
levels.what_they_know: Product, price, benefits. They want it.
levels.strategy: Direct offer, compelling reason to act NOW
levels.key_challenge: Give them a reason to act immediately, not later

levels.name: Product-Aware
levels.what_they_know: Product exists, unsure if it's the best choice
levels.key_challenge: Prove you're the best option among known alternatives

levels.name: Solution-Aware
levels.what_they_know: Result needed, not aware of your specific product
levels.strategy: Name their desire + connect to your solution
levels.key_challenge: Bridge from their goal to your method

levels.name: Problem-Aware
levels.what_they_know: Problem exists, no solution in mind
levels.strategy: Agitate pain + present yourself as the answer
levels.key_challenge: Make the pain vivid, then offer relief

levels.name: Unaware
levels.headline_approach: They Laughed When I Sat Down at the Piano...
levels.key_challenge: Create curiosity without mentioning product or problem

mapping_matrix.description: Lead archetype selection by awareness level

usage_rules.reference_by: Use semantic ID (e.g., AWARE_PROBLEM) not level number in all documents
usage_rules.diagnosis_first: Always identify awareness level before selecting headline/lead approach
usage_rules.common_mistake: Using direct approach on unaware audience (rejection) or indirect on most-aware (frustration)
usage_rules.funnel_principle: As prospect moves through funnel, awareness increases. Adjust messaging accordingly.
